info.title: MailChimp
info.description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.

parameters.name: dc
parameters.description: The portion after the dash in your API Key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: A valid API Key for your user account.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Is the method name from our API you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output Formats for Serialized calls.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: The campaign id to get content for (can be gathered using campaigns()).

parameters.name: for_archive
parameters.description: Controls whether we return the Archive version (true) or the Raw version (false), defaults to true.

get.description: Get the content (both html and text) for a campaign either as it would appear in the campaign archive or as the raw, original content.

parameters.name: dc
parameters.description: The portion after the dash in your API Key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: A valid API Key for your user account.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Is the method name from our API you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output Formats for Serialized calls.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The Campaign Type to create.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A hash of the standard options for this campaign. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content for this campaign. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

parameters.name: segment_opts
parameters.description: If you wish to do Segmentation with this campaign this array should contain: see campaignSegmentTest(). It's suggested that you test your options against campaignSegmentTest(). Also, "trans" campaigns do not support segmentation.

parameters.name: type_opts
parameters.description: Array for RSS, A/B Split or AutoResponder campaigns. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigncreate.func.php"

get.description: Create a new draft campaign to send.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output Formats for Serialized calls.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: The id of the campaign to schedule.

parameters.name: schedule_time
parameters.description: The time to schedule the campaign. For A/B Split "schedule" campaigns, the time for Group A - in YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS format in GMT.

parameters.name: schedule_time_b
parameters.description: The time to schedule Group B of an A/B Split "schedule" campaign - in YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS format in GMT.

get.description: Schedule a campaign to be sent in the future.

parameters.description: The list to test segmentation on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options for test segmentation. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaignsegmenttest.func.php"

get.description: Allows one to test their segmentation rules before creating a campaign using them.

get.description: Send a given campaign immediately. For RSS campaigns, this will "start" them.

parameters.name: test_emails
parameters.description: An array of email address to receive the test message.

parameters.name: send_type
parameters.description: By default (null) both formats are sent - "html" or "text" send just that format.

get.description: Send a test of this campaign to the provided email address.

parameters.description: Various parameters which can be used to configure the shared report. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaignsharereport.func.php"

get.description: Get the URL to a customized VIP Report for the specified campaign and optionally send an email to someone with links to it.

get.description: Get the HTML template content sections for a campaign. Note that this will return very jagged, non-standard results based on the template a campaign is using.

parameters.name: apikey

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: The Campaign Id to update.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's name (subject, from_email, etc.). Additional parameters will be that option name (content, segment_opts). "type_opts" will be the name of the type - rss, auto, trans, etc.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's value. For additional parameters, this is the same value passed to them.

get.description: Update just about any setting for a campaign that has not been sent.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: A hash of filters to apply to this query. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/campaigns.func.php"

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Control paging of campaigns, start results at this campaign #, defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Control paging of campaigns, number of campaigns to return with each call, defaults to 25 (max=1000).

get.description: Get the list of campaigns and their details matching the specified filters.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: For large data sets, the page number to start at - defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For large data sets, the number of results to return - defaults to 500, upper limit set at 1000.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Pull only messages since this time - use YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS format in GMT.

parameters.name: send_welcome
parameters.description: If your double_optin is false and this is true, we will send your lists Welcome Email if this subscribe succeeds - this will *not* fire if we end up updating an existing subscriber. If double_optin is true, this has no effect.

parameters.description: Flag to send the goodbye email to the email address.

parameters.name: send_notify
parameters.description: Flag to send the unsubscribe notification email to the address defined in the list email notification settings.

get.description: Unsubscribe the given email address from the list.

parameters.name: dc
parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The list id to connect.

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: The current email address of the member to update OR the "id" for the member returned from listMemberInfo, Webhooks, and Campaigns.

parameters.name: merge_vars
parameters.description: Array of new field values to update the member with. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listsubscribe.func.php"

parameters.name: email_type
parameters.description: Change the email type preference for the member. Leave blank to keep the existing preference (optional).

parameters.name: replace_interests
parameters.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the updated groups provided, or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.

get.description: Edit the email address, merge fields, and interest groups for a list member.

info.title: MailChimp
info.description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.
